before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gb37","text":"1. Validate all primers targeting the edited genomic locus prior to conducting any genome editing. Establish your melt temperature and cycles to make amplicons, confirming that your primer only amplify the desired locus and not any off-targets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"osml","text":"2. Perform genome editing with your preferred protocol. We use this one for S. rosetta:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4jn5","text":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.j8nlk86o5l5r/v1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":48}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B0EF5BBD698B11EFB48C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.j8nlk86o5l5r/v1"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4bos1","text":"Based on the DETECTR assay, this protocol screens for precise genomic insertions by programming a CRISPR RNA (crRNA) to direct LbCas12a to recognize an amplified genomic locus. This sensitive assay enables the detection of low frequency targets (limit of detection ~0.1-1%) in a plate-based format for high throughput screening. The protocol begins by seeding each well of a 96-well plate with clones or small populations of cells that have been genomically edited. After growing cells to saturation, genomic DNA is rapidly extracted with a buffer that is compatible for direct use in PCR reactions. LbCas12a is directly added to the PCR reaction to detect the presence of specific sequences from the amplified locus. Upon binding to the dsDNA target, LbCas12a can indiscriminately cleave single-stranded DNA (ssDNA). The conjugation of a fluorophore and quencher dye to an ssDNA substrate produces a fluorogenic probe to detect the LbCas12a nuclease activity that depends on dsDNA target recognition. A fluorogenic ssDNA probe is commercially available as a DNase Alert Substrate from Integrated DNA Technologies. This protocol was adapted by David Booth and his Lab at UCSF with special input from Fredrick Leon and Jesus Espinoza-Esparza, building on foundational work from Vicki Deng to optimally extract genomic DNA and to perform plate-based screens. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":13}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"108C20A789BA4F6FAAB87A37CF1144EA","url":"https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.aar6245"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sin9","text":"Replace PCR cover with an optically clear film cover and place plate in the qPCR instrument (or fluorescent plate reader if the plate is compatible).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14o6l","text":"Plate    into each well of several 96-well plates, increasing the number of plates if the expected editing efficiency is low.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4po0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"445al","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cf51t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"626vq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"of diluted cells","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7mvgq","text":"Distributing 100 µl of cells at a concentration of 45 cells/ml will result in a population in each well being seeding by 4-5 cells. If you expect that the mutant cell will result in a growth defect, consider lowering the starting concentration of cells and screening more plates, so the wild-type cells do not out compete a mutant with a growth defect. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23fa3","text":"Aliquot   into each well of a 96-well PCR plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5m73t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4e9a0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"anmaq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"36","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"DNAzol Direct","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"136jt","text":"DNAzol Direct:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2lp8o","text":"60% (w/v) PEG 200","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8jr90","text":"adjust to pH 13.3-13.7 with ~20 mM potassium hydroxide","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"404db","text":"Note: It is important to test a range of pH values to establish the optimal pH for your own use","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ej0c1","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

We recommend determining your limit of detection by titrating purified PCR products with the target sequence against amplicons that lack the target sequence, thereby maintaining a constant amount of dsDNA while varying the frequency of the target sequence","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
